div.a: Quality Checks and Corrective Action Documentation

translation.iqm2.text:
iQM2
Provides real-time detection, correction and documentation
Error detection reduced from
hours to minutes
A complete picture of
quality for every sample
Mitigates risks in all
phases of testing
translation.iqm2.title:
iQM2 vs. Traditional Quality Control
Reduces error-detection time from hours to minutes.
translation.processcontrol.title:
5 Process Control Solutions (PCSs)
5 PCSs continuously confirm sensor and GEM PAK performance.
translation.continuous.title:
5 Continuous Quality Checks
iQM2 automatically performs a continuous cycle of 5 quality checks.
translation.journey.title:
Journey of a Sample
Continuous quality assurance from sample introduction to results reporting.
translation.risk.title:
Risk Management Process
Identifies and reduces risks before, during and after every sample.
translation.traditional.text:
iQM2 vs. Traditional Quality Control
Automated, real-time assurance with iQM2 enhances patient care
Ensures accurate results, eliminating
delayed or inappropriate treatment
Rapid testing for immediate patient
management decisions
Provides caregivers more time at
bedside
Eliminates unnecessary re-testing
Enables quality processes, regardless
of operator or testing location

traditional.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“Better error detection, together with error pattern recognition, yields corrective actions that optimize test performance […]. These improvements in QC technology simplify operations […] and provide greater assurance that quality test results will be produced in any setting.”
James Westgard, PhD, developer of the ‘Westgard Rules’
Emeritus Professor, Dept. of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin Medical School Wisconsin, USA
Westgard J, Fallon K, Mansouri S. Validation of iQM Active Process Control Technology. Point of Care: The Journal of Near-Patient Testing and Technology. 2003;2(1):1-7.

translation.traditional.popup02.img01: Error automatically detected, corrected and documented immediately
translation.traditional.popup02.text02: All results from 8-hour period require review
translation.processcontrol.text:
5 Process Control Solutions (PCSs)
Continuous monitoring verifies PCS stability throughout cartridge use-life
PCSs are measured against known values
Immediate detection of reagent
deterioration assures quality results
pO2 is a sensitive identifier of closed
system stability

ul.li: Each PCS serves a specific function in the iQM2 process
Established target values across all PCSs monitor Medical-Decision Levels (MDLs) and ensure accuracy of results

translation.continuous.text:
5 Continuous Quality Checks
iQM2 automatically performs a
continuous cycle of 5 quality checks,
assuring quality before, during and
after every sample analysis—for real-
time assurance.
Ensures accuracy of results,
regardless of point-of-care
operator, time or place
Provides immediate correction
and documentation

continuous.popup.div:
Testimonial
“We need a fully automated analyzer that eliminates errors upfront to provide assured quality with every sample.”
James Nicholsd, Ph.D.
Chairperson of CLSI EP-23 Guideline
Vanderbilt University, Nashville, TN
Presented at: Trimark - Point of Care Testing Conference; March 2013; Washington DC.

translation.systemchecks.title: System Checks

systemchecks.text.p:
Ensures vital system component function to
reduce risk of pre-analytical variables
affecting results.

ul.li: Sample integrity and volume
Reagent performance
Mechanical and electronic subsystems
Fluidics

translation.sensorchecks.title: Sensor Checks
translation.sensorchecks.text:
Ensures integrity of every sample result:
5 levels of PCSs performed
automatically throughout GEM PAK
use-life to verify sensor, CO-Ox and
GEM PAK performance
Automatically evaluates PCS values
with Pattern Recognition checks
Real-time error detection, significantly
exceeds manual/auto QC intervals

sensorchecks.popup.div:
Testimonial
“The new, non-traditional QC parameters, continually monitored, introduce a groundbreaking level of quality management and assurance. No patient test result is released unless the entire test system is within specifications.”
Sharon Ehrmeyer, PhD
Professor, Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
Meeting US Regulation with Instrumentation Laboratory’s GEM Premier 5000 with Intelligent Quality Management 2. Data on File, IL

translation.sensorchecks.button: Continuous sensor checks provide quality assurance with every sample.
translation.intraspect.title: IntraSpect Checks
translation.intraspect.text:
Detects transient sample-specific errors
during measurement process missed by
traditional QC methods. Checks for
abnormal sensor response or residual
error potentially caused by:
Micro-clots
Micro-bubbles
Interferences
CO-Oximetry absorbance error due
to dyes, lipids, interferences
translation.intraspect.button01: Identifies sensor-slope shape and coefficient deviation.
translation.intraspect.button02: No other blood gas testing system can offer complete continuous monitoring of the entire process during sample measurement.

intraspect.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“Frequency of IntraSpect errors in our evaluation was 0.5 % (2 out of 430). IntraSpect identifies transient sample errors during the measurement process that are not flagged by traditional quality control methods. IntraSpect assists in minimizing the potential risk of reporting erroneous sample results which can impact patient safety/outcomes.”
Benedicte Beneteau-Burnat
Biochemical Laboratory
Saint Antoine Hospital Paris, France
GEM Premier 5000 (Werfen) Analyzer evaluation, risk assessment and practicability. Poster presented at 26th International AACC Point-of-Care Conference.Sept. 2016. Copenhagen, Denmark

translation.intraspect.popup02.title: IntraSpect
translation.intraspect.popup02: Identifies sensor-slope shape and coefficient deviation
translation.intraspect.popup03.title: Coefficient Range Development for IntraSpect

ul.li: A sigma range of 4-6 was used to set limits
Specific coefficient limits were assigned, based on data analysis for each analyte
Data: IL and field testing

translation.intraspect.popup04.title: Complete picture of quality before, during and after sample analysis
translation.intraspect.popup04: No other system offers complete continuous monitoring during the entire testing process.
translation.intraspect.popup05.title: IntraSpect Detects Sample-specific Transient Errors, Assuring Patient Safety

ul.li: IntraSpect detected coefficient outside of acceptability -45.31 and suppressed analyte result
If Glucose error had been undetected, inappropiate patient treatment could have resulted

translation.intraspect.popup06.title: Transient Errors - An Ongoing Challenge in Critical Care Testing
translation.intraspect.popup06: Transient/simple-specific errors in Critical Care testing are a known issue, reported frequently in literatura, with documented evidence of their impact on patient results.
translation.intraspect.popup07.title: Transient Errors - Recommendations to Improve Quality
translation.intraspect.popup07:
International CLSI laboratory standards state:
“A blood gas or electrolyte result may be acted on immediately with serious patient consequences before an erroneous result can be corrected.
“Monitoring the measuring system at shorter intervals increases the likelihood that systematic errors are detected before incorrect results are reported, or decreases the time before alerting the health care provider who may have received incorrect results.”
CLSI, October 2011. Laboratory Quality Control Based on Risk Management: Approved Guideline
translation.pattern.title: Pattern Recognition Checks
translation.pattern.text:
Identifies common sample errors and
interferences and automates corrective
actions:
Recognizes patterns generated by
sample, sensor, CO-Oximetry and
reagent errors (e.g., micro-clots,
Benzalkonium, CO-Ox/tBili spectral
errors)
Identifies and initiates intelligent
corrective actions
Increases workflow efficiencies by
automating quality management

pattern.popup.div:
Testimonial
“[iQM] error detection capabilities that function on every sample provide an additional safeguard against reporting erroneous results due to clots or interferences.”
Toffaletti JG, PhD, DABCC, et al.
Professor of Pathology Director, Blood Gas, Clinical Pediatric, Outpatient Labs
Duke University Medical Center, North Carollina, USA
Validation of a quality assessment for a blood gas and electrolyte testing. Clinical Chimica Acta. 2007;382:65-70

translation.pcs.title: PCS Stability Checks
translation.pcs.text:
Verifies PCS stability and GEM PAK integrity.
Immediate detection of reagent
deterioration assures quality results
pO2 in PCS A,D and E is compared
to initial measurement
pO2 is the most sensitive analyte for
detecting reagent deterioration
iQM2 alerts user if system detects PCS
instability
translation.pcs.button01: iQM2 measures PCSs every four hours to ensure system and PCS stability.
translation.pcs.button02: iQM2 continuously and actively monitors the total analytical system for complete quality assurance.
translation.pcs.button03: If PCS does not meet acceptable established limits, iQM2 wil halt operations until new GEM PAK installation.
translation.journey.text:
Journey of a Sample
Follow the journey of a sample through the GEM Premier 5000 system to see how iQM2 ensures accurate results, provides real-time assurance, improves patient care and increases operational efficiency with every sample.

journey.popup.div:
Testimonial
“The system is very easy to use and comes with a very low sample volume for a broad spectrum of analysis.”
Hugo Stiegler, MD
Head of Department Laboratory Medicine
Bergmannsheil, Bochum Germany
Das Intelligente Blutgas-Analysesystem. Medzin & Wissenschaft. 2016;May:16-7

translation.iqm2.popup.title: Key Benefits

ul.li: Rapid, quality-assured test results with every sample, not just every 8 hours
Identifies and reduces risk associated with testing processes before, during and after every sample
Prevents the reporting of erroneous results
Enables staff to spend more time at the bedside
Automates analyzer and operator management
Manages quality in self-contained GEM PAK
Eliminates outside variability
Eliminates maintenance
Menu- and volume-specific GEM PAK allow analyzer customization, tailored to unit needs
Allow system-wide control from any analyzer or PC
Keeps documentation just a click away

translation.sample.title: Sample Introduction
translation.sample.text01:
Designed to improve efficiency, the
Quick Start GUI, reduces potential errors
and enhances turnaround time.
translation.sample.text02:
Smartcolor status bar provides real-
time messaging for all analysis and
quality processes.
translation.sample.text03:
Sample is aspirated into the all-in one,
multi-use GEM PAK from the front-
facing illuminated sampling area.
Visual and tactical feedback
mechanisms to ensure proper
sample presentation.
translation.sample.text04:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
Tactical and visual sampler feedback
during aspiration helps ensure correct
sample introduction.
translation.sampleasp.title: Sample Aspiration
translation.sampleasp.text01:
Sample enters split pathway,
simultaneously running through the
sensor card and CO-Ox maximizing
sample turnaround time.
translation.sampleasp.text02:
System Checks - During every sample
aspiration, iQM2 performs various quality
checks to identify sample and reagent
specific errors (e.g., bubbles, insufficient
sample volume).
translation.iqmintra.title:
iQM2 IntraSpect
Checks
translation.iqmintra.text01:
IntraSpect collects readings during the
measurement process to detect
abnormal sensor response which may
be attributed to sample-specific
transient errors. Reducing risk of
erroneous results improves
patient care.
translation.iqmintra.text02:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE: The GEM
Premier 5000 system with iQM2 is the
only analyzer that performs sample
quality checks during the
measurement process.
translation.sensor.title: Sensor Card
translation.sentor.text01:
Sample flows over sensors and
produces an electric signal received by
the analyzer, proportionate to the
concentration of the measured analyte
in sample.
translation.sentor.text02:
Measurements for CO-Ox are
simultaneously run to provide a
complete menu of tests in 45 seconds.
translation.cooxi.title: CO-Oximetry
translation.cooxi.text01:
The sample flows into the mixing
chamber, red blood cells are chemically
lysed, and continue to mix as they are
pushed into the optical chamber.
translation.cooxi.text02:
Lysed sample is transported into the
CO-Ox window and absorbance
reading is captured by
spectrophotometer. Absorbance
spectra is analyzed using multi-variate
spectral analysis, minimizing
interferences.
translation.cooxi.text03:
IntraSpect and Pattern Recognition
Checks identify errors and initiate
intelligent corrective actions to mitigate
sample-specific errors.
translation.cooxi.text04:
iQM2 now verifies sensor and reagent
performance using NIST-traceable
PCS B.
PCS B follows the same fluidic pathway
as the sample through the Sensor Card
and CO-Ox cell, pushing
the sample to waste.

cooxi.popup.div:
Testimonial
“The ability to measure methemoglobin (metHb) in the NICU is important. A potential side effect of inhaled nitric oxide (NO) as a pulmonary dilator is the formation of MetHb. The presence of MetHb reduces the oxygen-carrying capacity of hemoglobin, impairs oxygen unloading at the tissue level […] and can cause significant lung injury.”
John Ance, RRT
Senior Clinical Consultant
Instrumentation Laboratory
Neonatal Critical Care Testing. RT for Decision Makers in Respiratory Care. 4 March, 2011. www.rtmagazine.com/2011/03/neonatal-critical-care-testing

translation.pcsb.title:
Process Control
Solution (PCS) B
translation.pcsb.text01:
Sensors produce an electric signal
received by the analyzer, proportionate
to the concentration of the measured
analyte in PCS B.
translation.pcsb.text02:
Before validation sample results, PCS B
checks for abnormal sensor response
associated with known errors, ensuring
correlation to measured values to
solution baseline values.
translation.pcsb.text03:
PCS B returns to normal after
eliminating any posible residual
spectral errors.

pcsb.popup.div:
Testimonial
“The GEM-iQM2 system automated and on-going analysis of PCSs and continual assessment of all critical measurement components ensure test quality while relieving operators of almost all traditional and time-consuming responsibilities associated with QC.”
Sharon Ehrmeyer, PhD
Professor, Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
Meeting US Regulations with Instrumentation Laboratory’s GEM Premier 5000 with Intelligent Quality Management 2. Data on File, IL

translation.results.title: Results
translation.results.text01:
GEM Premier 5000 system displays
patient results for all measured and
derived values.
Color-coding and sample
flagging simplify values that
require immediate user
notification.
Results can be printed or
transmitted to the LIS/HIS.
translation.results.text02:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
The GEM Premier 5000 with iQM2
is the only system that offers a
closed PAK, continuous quality
checks to detect abnormalities and
Pattern Recognition software,
allowing the identification of errors
(systematic or transient) traditional
QC may miss.
translation.challenge.title:
Challenge: Interfering
Substances
(Benzalkonium)
translation.challenge.text01:
Sample enters split pathway,
simultaneously running through the
sensor card and CO-Ox.
translation.challenge.text02:
Sample containing interferent flows over
sensors.
translation.challenge.text03:
IntraSpect identifies abnormal sensor
response during sample measurement
process and alerts user to analyte-
specific error.
translation.challenge.text04:
Benzalkonium, a common source of
pre-analytic error, may interfere with
sensor signal response during the
measurement process.
translation.challenge.text05:
PCS B sensor check detects
interference due to drifts in sensor
signal responses.
translation.challenge.text06:
Error pattern identifies interference as
Benzalkonium (BZK), based on PCS B-
positive Ca++ and Na+ drifts and no
negative K+ drift.
translation.challenge.text07:
iQM2 immediately displays an
interference alert to notify user.
translation.challenge.text08:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
Continuous quality checks and
immediate notification ensure
optimal results and patient safety.
translation.challenge.text09:
iQM2 automatically and intelligently
corrects the interference with
increased frequency of PCS B
cycles to prevent error in
subsequent sample results.
If iQM2 error mitigation is not
confirmed, the system disables
the sensor to prevent erroneous
results reporting.
translation.challenge.text10:
Interference flag is displayed on the
Results screen, for immediate user
notification.
translation.challenge.text11:
Corrective Action Report documents
corresponding iQM2 corrective
actions and sensor status.
translation.challenge.text12:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
iQM2 automatically detects,
corrects and documents errors
in real-time.
Traditonal QC does not identify
interfering substances which
remain undetected, affecting
current and subsequent
sample results.

challenge.popup.div:
Testimonial
“The GEM-iQM2 system [detects] clots, interferents, and common operator errors [...]. Assessment of these “quality parameters” is very relevant to total quality management of tests.”
Sharon Ehrmeyer, PhD, et al.
Professor, Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
Meeting US Regulations with Instrumentation Laboratory’s GEM Premier 5000 with Intelligent Quality Management 2. Data on File, IL

translation.cha.coox.title:
Challenge: CO-Ox
Interfering
Substances (Lipemia)
translation.cha.coox.text01:
Sample enters split pathway,
simultaneously running through
sensor card and CO-Ox.
translation.cha.coox.text02:
Sample flows into the mixing
chamber, red blood cells are chemically
lysed, and continue to mix while being
pushed into optical chamber.
translation.cha.coox.text03:
Lysed lipemic sample flows into
CO-Ox window and absorbance
reading is captured by
spectrophotometer.
translation.cha.coox.text04:
iQM2 analyzes sample absorbance
readings and utilizes Pattern
Recognition software to detect
abnormalities. Sample reference
library identifies interfering
substances that can affect patient
results and determines
acceptable limits of lipemia.
translation.cha.coox.text05:
PCS B flows into CO-Ox cell, pushing
sample to waste.
translation.cha.coox.text06:
PCS B also checks for abnomal
absorbance readings in CO-Ox to
eliminate any possible residual spectral
errors.
translation.cha.coox.text07:
iQM2 will automatically correct
and report results from samples
with lipemia < 5% and will flag
results with turbidity flag if
samples contain lipemia > 5%.
translation.cha.coox.text08:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
Continuous quality checks and
immediate notification ensures
optimal results and patient safety.
translation.cha.micro.title: Challenge: Micro-clot
translation.cha.micro.text01:
Sample enters split pathway,
simultaneously running through
sensor card and CO-Ox.
translation.cha.micro.text02:
Sample containing micro-clot flows over
sensors.
translation.cha.micro.text03:
IntraSpect identifies abnormal sensor
response during sample measurement
process and alerts user to analyte
specific error.
translation.cha.micro.text04:
Micro-clots, a common source of pre-
analytic error, can interfere with sensor
signal response during measurement
process by adhering to a sensor.
Micro-clots may be as small as
a fibrin strand.
translation.cha.micro.text05:
PCS B sensor check detects
interference due to drifts in sensor
signal responses.
translation.cha.micro.text06:
PCS B sensor check detects a negative
drift in sensor signal response.
translation.cha.micro.text07:
PCS A determines if pattern indicates a
micro-clot. A negative drift in PCS B
and positive drift in PCS A is a Pattern
Recognition signature of a micro-clot.
translation.cha.micro.text08:
iQM2 immediately notifies user of
confirmed micro-clot.
translation.cha.micro.text09:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
Continuous quality checks and
immediate notification ensure optimal
results and patient safety.
translation.cha.micro.text10:
iQM2 automatically and intelligently
corrects error with clot-bust rinse to
prevent fibrin strands from affecting
subsequent results.
translation.cha.micro.text11:
iQM2 confirms that corrective action is
successful by performing PCS B and
PCS A.
translation.cha.micro.text12:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
With traditional QC (auto or manual),
clots and micro-clots can affect a
sensor, alter system performance and
potentially affect subsequent results
until the next QC replicate.
translation.cha.micro.text13:
Micro-clot flag is displayed
on results screen on
affected analyte.
translation.cha.micro.text14:
iQM2 verifies successful error
mitigation prior to allowing further
sample analysis. If micro-clot
cannot be removed, iQM2 disables
sensor to prevent reporting of
erroneous results.
translation.cha.micro.text16:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
No other system automatically
detects, corrects and documents
errors in real-time.

cha.micro.popup.div:
Testimonial
“[iQM2] provide[s] test-site directors [...] a fully documented means of meeting their appropriate “regulatory” responsibilities with assurance that requirements are fully addressed–in a manner completely transparent to the operators.”
Sharon Ehrmeyer, PhD, et al.
Professor, Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
Meeting US Regulations with Instrumentation Laboratory’s GEM Premier 5000 with Intelligent Quality Management 2. Data on File, IL

translation.cha.bubb.title:
Challenge:
Micro-bubbles
translation.cha.bubb.text01:
Sample enters split pathway,
simultaneously running through
sensor card and CO-Ox.
translation.cha.bubb.text02:
Sample containing micro-bubbles flows
over sensors.
translation.cha.bubb.text03:
IntraSpect identifies abnormal sensor
response during sample measurement
process and alerts user to analyte-
specific error.
translation.cha.bubb.text04:
Micro-bubbles, a common source of
pre-analytic error, may interfere with
sensor signal response during
measurement process. Micro-bubbles
may be invisible when visually
inspecting sample prior to analysis.
translation.cha.bubb.text05:
PCS B flushes sample containing
micro-bubbles to the waste bag. No
residual error is detected during
sensor/CO-Ox checks utilizing PCS B.
translation.cha.bubb.text06:
IntraSpect flag appears next to
affected analyte, immediately
notifying user. Flagging transient
errors ensures quality results during
every sample measurement.
translation.cha.bubb.text07:
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
Continuous quality checks before,
during and after every sample
provides immediate notification,
ensure optimal results and patient
care.
translation.quality.title:
Quality Checks and
Corrective Action
Documentation
translation.quality.text01:
iQM2 automatically records
and stores all results.
Configurable color-coded
values facilitate identification
of critical patient results.
translation.quality.text02:
All Corrective Action Reports,
iQM2 Delta Charts and other
reports are available on
demand.
translation.quality.text03:
iQM2 meets and exceeds
regulatory requirements (e.g.,
ISO 15189/22870) for quality
documentation by automatically
storing all reports electronically.
translation.quality.text04:
Sample Handling and Enhanced
Reports facilitate targeted
operator training.
translation.quality.text05:
Configurable electronic signature
workflows ensure a timely and
complete quality assurance
program, inspection-ready at the
touch of a button.

quality.popup.div:
Testimonial
“The GEM-iQM2 system introduces a new quality control/quality assurance paradigm, which greatly advances state-of-the-art quality practices [...] it not only meets, but exceeds, the requirements of CMS (CLIA), CAP, JC and COLA.”
Sharon Ehrmeyer, PhD, et al.
Professor, Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
Meeting US Regulations with Instrumentation Laboratory’s GEM Premier 5000 with Intelligent Quality Management 2. Data on File, IL

translation.risk.text:
Risk Management Process
Encompasses all aspects of Risk
Management:
Identifies and mitigates potential risks
throughout the entire testing process,
from pre- through post-analytical
phases
Automatically documents all risk-
management process activities to
fulfill regulatory requirements

risk.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“iQM2 fits perfectly into the risk management approach because it addresses so many potential errors.”
James Westgard, PhD, developer of the ‘Westgard Rules’
Emeritus Professor, Dept. of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin Medical School Wisconsin, USA
Validation of iQM Active Process Control Technology. Point of Care: The Journal of Near-Patient Testing and Technology, 2003;2(1):1-7

translation.risk.popup02.title: Common Deficiencies Cited by Regulatory Organizations

ul.li: Personnel qualifications and associated records
Competency assessments, including all six elements
Proficiency testing
Method comparisons and calibration verification
Equipment maintenance and associated documentation

risk.popup02.text.ol: Hess, N. The Inspection-Ready Lab. MLO. 2016;48(7):38-44.

translation.risk.popup03.title: CLSI EP23-A Guideline

ul.li: Clinical and Laboratory Standards Institute (CSLI) risk-based approach to quality control

Centers for Medicaid and Medicare SProvides one-touch menu selection with flexible configurations, customizable by department ervices (CMS) adapted EP23-A concepts for new CLIA quality control option - Individualized Quality Control Plan (IQCP)
Goals of EP-23/IQCP
ul.ol: - Address “limited ability” of some manufacturers’ “built-in quality assessments” to truly evaluate test quality
- Ensure test restul quality by eliminating significant risk in entire testing process
- Allow sites to develop quality strategies appropiate for specific testing situation

translation.risk.popup04.title: Individualized Quality Control Plans (IQCP)

ul.li: Strategy to mitigate and prevent errors throughout the entire testing process for improved quality and patient safety
Prevent failures and detect nonconformities that may occur before incorrect results are reported
Requires a thorough understanding of the 3 phases of testing

translation.risk.popup05.title: IQCP Development Process
translation.risk.popup05.text:
Facilities are encouraged to:
Perform a risk assessment - Examine the entire testing process (from pre-analytical through post-analytical) - Determine where potential errors can occur - Assess if these errors can be detected by current quality assessment practices
Develop a quality control plan - Where necessary, implement appropriate procedures to mitigate/reduce (residual) errors to an acceptable level Final IQCP based on: - Regulatory requirements - Manufacturer information - Testing environment
translation.risk.popup06.title: IQCP and ISO 15189

ul.li: Based on risk assessments and risk management
Aim to change processes to reduce or eliminate the identified risks and document decisions and actions
Require the lab to be responsible for monitoring and evaluating performance through critical aspects of pre-analytical, analytical and post-analytical processes

translation.risk.popup07.title: GEM Premier 5000 System Developed to Mitigate Risk of Potential Errors*
translation.risk.popup07.text:
Designed to include advanced technologies:
Eliminates steps/re-engineer proces
Includes software enhancements
Automates quality control processes and review Goals
Enhanced quality of results *http://aacc.org/members/divisions/cpoct/poc_forum/Documents/AstionAACC_POCsafetysubm.pdf
translation.risk.popup08.title: CLSI EP-23 Risk Assessment Model of the GEM Premier 5000 system

ul.li: iQM2 identifies samples with high lipemia >5% through IntraSpect and Pattern Recognition Checks**
iQM2 alerts user and can correct patient results with lipemia concentrations ≤5%
Onboard sample collection training videos help reduce error
Patient history includes delta differences for each analyte
iQM2 automatically performs sample integrity checks on each sample with use of Sensor/CO-Ox Checks and Patterns Recognition Checks
iQM2 alerts user and automatically initiates intelligent corrective actions
iQM2 automatically performs sample integrity checks on each sample including System, IntraSpect, Sensor/CO-Ox and Patterns Recognition Checks
iQM2 alerts user and automatically initiates intelligent corrective actions
Barcode scanner ensures proper sample ID
Customizable patient ID entry requirements and configurations for: Pre-existing orders, automatic patient demographic fetch/search functions and ADT/POC order creation (GEMweb Plus)

risk.popup09.table.p:
Based on EP18/23* Note: Errors can be associated with pre-analytical or analytical phase of testing
** 5% of 10% intralipid with a final concentration of 0.5%

ul.li: Operator management/security lockout to ensure user is authorized
GEMweb Plus Custom Connectivity offers broad configurable operator competency functions
Operator management/security lockout to ensure user is authorized
GEMweb Plus Custom Connectivity offers broad configurable operator competency functions
GEMweb Plus Custom Connectivity operator competency features include: 30-day warning messaging, operator competency exams, configurable practical competency sign-off and realtime certification
APV verifies PCS performance and integrity of each PAk after insertion
iQM2 performs continuous PCS stability checks throughout PAK use-life
iQM2 performs continuous PCS checks throughout PAK use-life with NIST-traceable PCSs
GEM PAKs are checked for expiration date and use-life when inserted (EEPROM)
iQM2 Sensor/CO-Ox Checks are performed using PCSs, any precision failure will automatically initiate corrective actions
All PAKs are verified upon insertion and throughout use-life with NIST-traceable PCSs and AVP with specific ranges to monitor lot-to-lot variations
Sensors outside of the acceptable PCS/AVP ranges are disabled
iQM2 automatically performs Sensor/CO-Ox Checks using PCSs and Pattern Recognition Checks
iQM2 immediately alerts user to sensor malfunctions
iQM2 automatically initiates intelligent corrective actions when malfunctions are detected
iQM2 continuously performs system fuction checks, including temperature checks
iQM2 continuously performs system function checks, including electrical checks
Self-contained PAKs prevent dust from entering the system
GEM Premier 5000 system operates independent of barometric pressure
GEM PAK PCS bags have zero head space for operation over a wide range of atmospheric pressures with no change in dissolved gas concentration

System checks performed continuously (e.g., cartridge fluidics and mechanical, heater block temperature, sensor mV output threshold, and instrument electronic checks, including analog/digital electronic calibration verification and communication between processors)
iQM2 continuously performs system function checks, including electrical checks
No required maintenance on hardware or GEM PAK
iQM2 continuously performs system and PAK checks
